Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2008 01:03PM beachlover89 wrote: Im 43 and pretty healthy no health issues, went for my first mammogram a week ago.  Next day, doctor's office called and said they would like a follow up mammogram of specific spots along with an ultrasound.  Went and had it done and was a nervous wreck because tech seemed concerned especially with left breast.  When she was finished, she told me to go ahead and I could leave without having ultrasound done.  Doctor called me back this morning and told me it was benign calicifcations. I seemed at ease until several friends mentioned to me that I should seek a second opinion and that how could they make determination without ultrasound and/or biopsy being done.  Should I seek second opinion or just wait for the twelve months and follow up with my yearly mammogram?  Very confused right now -- have heard horror stories of this being precursor to breast cancer -- not to mention everything I googled online mentioned biopsy.
